activities.loc: JMB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca L Ferguson

records.addlTxt:
11:38 AM Defendant Rebecca L Ferguson appeared by video.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Rebecca L Ferguson. Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rockow relates, reading waived, not guilty pleas entered.
Plea hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 10:00 am.

4:02 PM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rebecca L Ferguson appeared by video.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Rebecca L Ferguson. 
Officer Torey Belich called and sworn - Direct by State 4:06 No cross by Attorney Rockow.  State moves for bind over.  Court finds probable cause and binds over.  Next hearing may be by zoom.  Address and phone number confirmed.
Arraignment scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 17, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

10:35 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rebecca L Ferguson appeared by video.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Rebecca L Ferguson. 

Formal reading waived. Preliminary hearing set. May appear by zoom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

1:14 PM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rebecca L Ferguson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alex Kitto appeared by video for Rebecca L Ferguson for today.
Court questions Defendant.  State requests cash bond.  Attorney Kitto and Defendant put in a break out room.  1:21 Attorney Kitto requests high signature bond.  Court sets bond.  Next hearing may be by zoom or in person.  Defendant must contact Public Defender's office and if she does not qualify complete and turn in a blue form today.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
